Position: Human Resources Business Partner 
• Responsible for aligning business objectives strategy to HC strategy with 
employees and management, assessing and anticipating  in HC-related needs . 
• Recommend and advise on the Human Capital -related communications to 
ensure meeting the tar geted change management and communication plans.  
• Follow up on major Human Capital -related assignments to support timely 
completion, while providing the team with the needful support.  
• Keep abreast on the updates of the Human Capital updates; policies, 
strategies, reviews, projects, and initiatives for the required communication or 
action.  
• Draft and Review corporate policies to ensure meeting specific -business 
requirements to enable performance by people  and functions.  
• Manage and resolve complex HC issues wit h the business, seeking the counsel 
of other HC resources as required. Conduct effective, thorough and objective 
investigations.  
• Facilitate and provide guidance and input on all aspects of HC strategy, 
programs, policies and processes, including: organizat ional re -structuring; job 
evaluation; workforce planning; performance management; recruitment, 
selection and on -boarding; succession planning; learning & development; 
redeployment plans; secondment; reward management; employee 
engagement; etc.  
• Participate in the business reviews to provide with the needful insights and 
reports regarding the Human Capital processes, updates, and pertain 
information to support the decision making.

Dec 2007 to Oct 2019 Abu Dhabi Autonomous Systems Investments - Subsidiary 
of Tawazun  
Position : Human Resources Manager  
Responsibilities:   
• responsible for the smooth and profitable operation of human resources 
department by supervise  and provide consultation to management on strategic 
staffing plans  including recruitment and selection , compensation, benefits, 
training and dev elopment, budget, and labour  relations.  
•  Responsible for developing  a culture that enables employees to perform in 
accordance to company’s  objectives.  
• Lead performance management, talent assessment, and effective labour 
relationships, including negotiatin g and administering labour agreements.  
• Supervises HR staff and reports to the chief executive officer on issues 
regarding implementation of policies and procedures, safety of the workforce, 
recruiting and hiring high -performing employees, and labour, legis lative and 
other human resources issues.  
• Development and implementation of development programs, employee 
orientation and training programs, benefits plan, policies and guidelines, 
database management procedures, equal opportunity employment programs, 
and to support in employee records and documentation policies.  
• Evaluating effectiveness through compiling and analysing data  by preparing 
and distributing various reports on HR metrics to ensure needs are met . 
• Provide senior management and others with various  types of employee reports 
including attrition, absence, compensation, annual leave, overtime costs and 
headcount  
• Ensuring compliance with federal and labour laws and industry when related to 
legal implications of employment legalization and HR issues rela ted to 
discipline and employee grievances.  
• Planning and overseeing the HR department budget.  
• Manage of all new  employees and contract staff.   
• Manage all redundancy situations including calculations, financial guidance 
and communications to affected emplo yees. 
• Management of risk assessments, audits and revisions of policy and 
procedures. Engage with consultants on an ad hoc basis.  
• Design and implementation of a company -wide performance management 
system that is linked to the core vision and objectives of t he business. Provision 
of on -going consultation to management on performance related issues . 
• Managing monthly payroll process and assure timely implementation.  
• Keep up to date with current HR/Labour  legislation and ensure this is updated 
in the company's H uman Resource policies.
